sen.j: いき（粋）とは、日本の美意識（美的観念）のひとつである。
sen.e: "Iki" is one of the Japanese aesthetic senses (aesthetic concepts).
"Iki" is a Japanese aesthetic sense (aesthetic concept).
"Iki" is a Japanese aesthetic sense (aesthetic concept).

sen.j: 江戸時代後期に、江戸深川 (江東区)の町人の間に発生したとされる。
sen.e: It is said to have emerged among the townspeople of Fukagawa (Koto Ward), Edo, during the late Edo period.
It is said to have emerged among the townspeople of Fukagawa (Koto Ward), Edo (modern-day Tokyo), during the late Edo period.
It is said to have emerged among the townspeople of Fukagawa (Koto Ward), Edo (modern-day Tokyo), during the late Edo period.

sen.j: 身なりや振る舞いが洗練されていて、格好よいと感じられること。
sen.e: It is being refined in dress and manners and considered good-looking.
It is being refined in dress and manners and considered good-looking.
It is being refined in dress and manners and considered good-looking.

sen.j: また、人情に通じていること、遊び方を知っていることなどの意味も含む。
sen.e: It also means being humane, knowing how to play, etc.
It also means being humane, knowing how to have a good time, etc.
It also means being humane, knowing how to have a good time, etc.

sen.j: 反対語は野暮である。
sen.e: The antonym of iki is yabo (being uncouth, senseless, rustic, etc.).
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: The antonym of iki is yabo (being uncouth, senseless, rustic, etc.).
The antonym of iki is yabo (being uncouth, senseless, rustic, etc.).

sen.j: 「いき」には、単純美への志向など、わび・寂などの日本の美的観念と共通部分もある。
sen.e: Iki' shares an orientation toward simple beauty and other characteristics in common with other Japanese aesthetic concepts like wabi (a state of calm, quiet subtlety which avoids being gaudy or showy) and sabi (austere elegance which reflects simplicity and loneliness).
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。または、wabi (subtle taste) and sabi (elegant simplicity)でもよいか思います。 (http://eow.alc.co.jp/%e3%82%8f%e3%81%b3%e3%81%a8%e3%81%95%e3%81%b3/UTF-8/?ref=ex&exp=A0000315&dn=1954746&dk=JE&pg=1)
sen.e: Iki' shares characteristics such as an orientation toward simple beauty in common with other Japanese aesthetic concepts like wabi (a state of calm, quiet subtlety which avoids being gaudy or showy) and sabi (austere elegance which reflects simplicity and loneliness).

Iki' shares characteristics such as an orientation toward simple beauty in common with other Japanese aesthetic concepts like wabi (a state of calm, quiet subtlety which avoids being gaudy or showy) and sabi (austere elegance which reflects simplicity and loneliness).

sen.j: また、これまで海外ではわび・寂びが日本の美学の代表のように捉えられていることもある。
sen.e: Wabi and sabi have been perceived to represent Japanese aesthetics abroad until now.
Overseas, wabi and sabi have, until now, been perceived of as representing Japanese aesthetics.
Overseas, wabi and sabi have, until now, been perceived of as representing Japanese aesthetics.

sen.j: だが、無常などの宗教観念と関連するわび・寂びは難解とさる。
sen.e: However, wabi and sabi that are related to religious concepts like mujo (transience) are considered difficult to understand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: However, being related to religious concepts like mujo (transience), wabi and sabi are considered difficult to understand.
However, being related to religious concepts like mujo (transience), wabi and sabi are considered difficult to understand.

sen.j: 日本人でも説明するのは簡単ではない。
sen.e: It is not easy even for Japanese people to explain these concepts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It is not easy even for Japanese people to explain these concepts.
It is not easy even for Japanese people to explain these concepts.

sen.j: また、現在の日本人の日常生活からは、わび・寂びはむしろ遠のきつつあるともいえる。
sen.e: Also, wabi and sabi are rather becoming remote from the present daily life of Japanese people.
Also, wabi and sabi are becoming rather remote from the present daily life of Japanese people.
Also, wabi and sabi are becoming rather remote from the present daily life of Japanese people.

sen.j: これに比較して、「いき」は「さっぱり」「すっきり」などという形容が当てはまるように、より親しみやすく、意味は拡大されている。
sen.e: In comparison, 'iki' may also mean 'sappari' (neat, frank, and plain) and 'sukkiri' (neat and clear) when used as an adjective, and it is more friendly and has a broader meaning than before.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: In comparison, 'iki' may also mean 'sappari' (neat, frank, and plain) and 'sukkiri' (neat and clear) when used as an adjective, and it is more friendly and has a broader meaning than before.
In comparison, 'iki' may also mean 'sappari' (neat, frank, and plain) and 'sukkiri' (neat and clear) when used as an adjective, and it is more friendly and has a broader meaning than before.

sen.j: 現在でも広く日常的に使われる。
sen.e: Even today it is widely and routinely used in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Even today it is widely and routinely used in Japan.
Even today it is widely and routinely used in Japan.

sen.j: 「いき」に対して「いなせ」という言葉がある。
sen.e: There is a word 'inase' having a similar meaning to 'iki'.
There is a word 'inase' having a similar meaning to 'iki'.
There is a word 'inase' having a similar meaning to 'iki.'

sen.j: 「いき」は火消しのことで「いなせ」は魚屋の事だといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that 'iki' concerns fire fighters and 'inase' fishmongers.
It is said that 'iki' concerns fire fighters and 'inase' fishmongers.
It is said that 'iki' concerns fire fighters and 'inase' fishmongers.

sen.j: 「いきでいなせな」と続けて用いられることも多い。
sen.e: They are often used consecutively as follows: 'iki de inase na'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: They are often used together in the phrase 'iki de inase na'.
They are often used together in the phrase 'iki de inase na'.

sen.j: しかし、必ずしも使用者が明確に使い分けているとは限らない。
sen.e: However, it is not necessarily the case that the users know how to use them properly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, it is not necessarily the case that the users know how to use them properly.
However, it is not necessarily the case that the users know how to use them properly.

sen.j: 九鬼による「いき」
sen.e: Iki' by Kuki
Iki' by Kuki
Iki' by Kuki

sen.j: 九鬼周造『「いき」の構造』（1930）では、「いき」という江戸特有の美意識が初めて哲学的に考察された。
sen.e: Shuzo KUKI for the first time philosophically examined the aesthetic sense of 'iki' that was unique to Edo in "The Structure of 'iki'" (1930).
Shuzo KUKI for the first time philosophically examined the aesthetic sense of 'iki' that was unique to Edo in "The Structure of 'iki'" (1930).
Shuzo KUKI for the first time philosophically examined the aesthetic sense of 'iki' that was unique to Edo in "The Structure of 'iki'" (1930).

sen.j: 九鬼周造は『「いき」の構造』において、いきを「他の言語に全く同義の語句が見られない」ことから日本独自の美意識として位置付けた。
sen.e: In his book, he positioned it as an aesthetic sense original to Japan, considering that 'other languages do not have any synonymous words'.
In his book, he positioned it as an aesthetic sense original to Japan, considering that 'other languages do not have any synonymous words'.
In his book, he positioned it as an aesthetic sense original to Japan, considering that 'other languages do not have any synonymous words.'

sen.j: 外国語で意味が近いものに「coquetterie」「esprit」などを挙げたが、形式を抽象化することによって導き出される類似・共通点をもって文化の理解としてはならないとした。
sen.e: While he mentioned 'coquetterie', 'esprit', and so on as the foreign words of kindred meaning, he argued that the common or similar points derived through the abstraction of forms should not be used to understand a culture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: While he mentioned that foreign words such as 'coquetterie' and 'esprit' have a similar meaning, he argued that common or similar points derived through the abstraction of forms should not be used to understand a culture.

While he mentioned that foreign words such as 'coquetterie' and 'esprit' have a similar meaning, he argued that common or similar points derived through the abstraction of forms should not be used to understand a culture.

sen.j: 経験的具体的に意識できることをもっていきという文化を理解するべきであると唱えた。
sen.e: He contended that the comprehension of the culture of iki should be based on experiential and concrete consciousness.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: He contended that the comprehension of the culture of iki should be based on experiential and concrete consciousness.
He contended that the comprehension of the culture of iki should be based on experiential and concrete consciousness.

sen.j: また、同書中で九鬼周造はいきには必ず異性に対する「媚態」が根本にあり、異性間の緊張がつねに存在している状態がいきの構成要素である「つやっぽさ」や「色気」を作り出すとしている。
sen.e: In the same book, he also claimed that 'bitai' (coquetry) toward the opposite sex invariably underlies iki and the permanent existence of sexual tension produces its components, such as 'tsuyapposa' (amorousness) and 'iroke' (sex appeal).

In the same book, he also claimed that 'bitai' (coquetry) toward the opposite sex invariably underlies iki and that the permanent existence of sexual tension produces its components, such as 'tsuyapposa' (amorousness) and 'iroke' (sex appeal).

In the same book, he also claimed that 'bitai' (coquetry) toward the opposite sex invariably underlies iki and that the permanent existence of sexual tension produces its components, such as 'tsuyapposa' (amorousness) and 'iroke' (sex appeal).

sen.j: また別の面として、いきの要諦には江戸の人々の道徳的理想が色濃く反映されており、それは「いき」のうちの「意気地」に集約される。
sen.e: On the other hand, the essence of iki is also heavily colored by the moral ideal of the Edo people, and it is summarized in the 'ikiji' (guts), one of the components of 'iki'.
sen.cmt: 用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: On the other hand, the essence of iki is also heavily colored by the moral ideal of the Edo people, and is summarized in 'ikiji' (guts), one of the components of 'iki'.
On the other hand, the essence of iki is also heavily colored by the moral ideal of the Edo people, and is summarized in 'ikiji' (guts), one of the components of 'iki.'

sen.j: いわゆるやせ我慢と反骨精神にそれが表れている。
sen.e: It shows through in the so-called yasegaman (fake stoicism) and hankotsu-seishin (a spirit of defiance).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。用語集の用語はこの文脈では合わないので、変更しています。
sen.e: This shows through in the so-called yasegaman (fake stoicism) and hankotsu-seishin (a spirit of defiance).
This shows through in the so-called yasegaman (fake stoicism) and hankotsu-seishin (a spirit of defiance).

sen.j: そして、「宵越しの金を持たぬ」と言う気風と誇りが「いき」であるとされた。
sen.e: And the spirit and pride embodied in the proverb, 'do not keep one's earnings overnight', are considered 'iki' (stylish).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The spirit and pride embodied in the proverb, 'do not keep one's earnings overnight', are also considered 'iki' (stylish).
The spirit and pride embodied in the proverb, 'do not keep one's earnings overnight,' are also considered 'iki' (stylish).

sen.j: 九鬼周造はその著書において端的に「理想主義の生んだ『意気地』によって媚態が霊化されていることが『いき』の特色である。」と述べている。
sen.e: Shuzo KUKI succinctly stated in his book that it is the distinctive feature of "iki" that bitai is spiritualized by "ikiji" that is inspired by idealism.
Shuzo KUKI succinctly stated in his book that a distinctive feature of "iki" is that bitai is spiritualized by idealism-inspired "ikiji".
Shuzo KUKI succinctly stated in his book that a distinctive feature of "iki" is that bitai is spiritualized by idealism-inspired "ikiji."

sen.j: 九鬼の議論では、伝統的にはむしろ野暮の代表である侍を持ち出すことで「いき」が町人の文化であることを軽視している点、西洋哲学での理屈付けをしている点には批判もある。
sen.e: The argument of Kuki has been criticized on the following grounds: it neglects that 'iki' is the culture of the townspeople by bringing up samurai (warriors) who, if anything, has traditionally represented 'yabo'; and it follows the Western philosophical logic.

Kuki's argument has been criticized on the grounds that, by bringing up samurai (warriors) who, if anything, have traditionally represented 'yabo', it neglects the fact that 'iki' is the culture of the townspeople, and also that it follows Western philosophical logic.

Kuki's argument has been criticized on the grounds that, by bringing up samurai (warriors) who, if anything, have traditionally represented 'yabo,' it neglects the fact that 'iki' is the culture of the townspeople, and also that it follows Western philosophical logic.

sen.j: いきと粋
sen.e: Iki and sui (quintessence)
Iki and sui (quintessence)
Iki and sui (quintessence)

sen.j: いきは一般的には粋と表記されることが多いが、上方の美意識である「粋（すい）」と区別するために専門的には「いき」と表記される。
sen.e: Iki is generally transcribed as 粋, but it is technically spelled 'いき' (iki) in order to distinguish it from '粋 (sui)' that is the aesthetic sense of Kamigata (the Kyoto-Osaka district).

Iki is generally written with the character "粋", but in specialist works it is written phonetically as 'いき' (iki) in order to distinguish it from "粋" (sui), which is the aesthetic sense of Kamigata (the Kyoto-Osaka district).

Iki is generally written with the character "粋," but in specialist works it is written phonetically as 'いき' (iki) in order to distinguish it from "粋" (sui), which is the aesthetic sense of Kamigata (the Kyoto-Osaka district).

sen.j: 両者は同じ字をあてる。
sen.e: The same character is applied to both.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: Both 'iki' and 'sui' are written with the same character.
Both 'iki' and 'sui' are written with the same character.

sen.j: しかし、上方の「粋（すい）」が恋愛や装飾などにおいて突き詰めた末に結晶される文化様式（結果としての、心中や絢爛豪華な振袖の着物など）、字のごとく純粋の「粋（すい）」であるのに対し、江戸における「いき」とは突き詰めない、上記で解説した異性間での緊張を常に緊張としておくために、突き放さず突き詰めず、常に距離を接近せしめることによって生まれると言われる。
sen.e: However, while the 'sui' of Kamigata refers to the cultural pattern that crystallizes after the notion of love, decorations, and so on is looked into thoroughly -- such as a shinju (a lover's suicide) and a gorgeous and luxurious long-sleeved kimono that come out as a result of the thorough inquiry -- and it literally means 'sui' of junsui (purity), the 'iki' of Edo is said to emerge as a result of constantly getting closer, without being detached or attached, in order to keep the above-described sexual tension alive.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: However, while the 'sui' of Kamigata refers to the cultural pattern that crystallizes after love, decorations, and so on have been thoroughly thought through (resulting in things such as a lovers' suicide or a luxurious kimono) and is literally the 'sui' of junsui (purity), the 'iki' of Edo is said to be the result of constantly getting closer, without becoming detached or attached, in order to keep the above-described sexual tension alive.

However, while the 'sui' of Kamigata refers to the cultural pattern that crystallizes after love, decorations, and so on have been thoroughly thought through (resulting in things such as a lovers' suicide or a luxurious kimono) and is literally the 'sui' of junsui (purity), the 'iki' of Edo is said to be the result of constantly getting closer, without becoming detached or attached, in order to keep the above-described sexual tension alive.

sen.j: 江戸の「いき」の表記は「意気」を当てることもある。
sen.e: The 'iki' of Edo is sometimes written as '意気' (iki).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: The 'iki' of Edo is sometimes written as '意気' (iki).
The 'iki' of Edo is sometimes written as '意気' (iki).

sen.j: その他にもさまざまな表記がある。
sen.e: There are also various other notations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。
sen.e: It can also be written various other ways.
It can also be written various other ways.
